entry.title: ToLiss Announces Airbus A320ceo Release Date
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. After releasing the A320neo for X-Plane in 2023, ToLiss has announced that the much-loved A320ceo will soon join the line-up, coming for X-Plane 12 next Friday, as an expansion package. First launched in the mid-1980s and entering service with Air France in 1988, the A320ceo was revolutionary for introducing all-digital, fly-by-wire controls to the airliner market. The family grew to include the A318, A319, and A321, and became a workhorse for airlines across the globe. The ToLiss A320ceo will come with both the CFM56-5B4 and IAE V2527-A5 powerplants, and will require the ToLiss A320neo base package to run. ToLiss has confirmed that pre-release copies of the A320ceo expansion will be going out to streamers and reviewers very soon, so expect full previews, walkthroughs, and performance showcases in the coming days. ToLiss hasnât confirmed which platforms it will release on just yet, but going by past launches, you can expect to see it available through the X-Plane.org Store, Aerosoft , and Simmarket. For the full post, visit this link. The ToLiss A320ceo is releasing Friday, Sep. 26. The expansion will be priced at $29.95. For all the latest news and updates, stay tuned on Threshold! entry.title: iniBuilds Releases Cape Town International Airport (FACT) for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iniBuilds has recently released their rendition of Cape Town International Airport (FACT) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. The airport serves the city of Cape Town, South Africa, and has a yearly average of 10 million passengers. It opened in 1954, replacing the cityâs previous airport, Wingfield Aerodrome. From humble beginnings as a domestic airport, it quickly reached international status with the introduction of a direct flight to Britain. In the early 1990s, the airportâs ownership was transferred from the state to a private company (Airports Company South Africa), and it was renamed a politically neutral âCape Town International Airportâ instead of the pre-apartheid âD. F. Malan Airport.â Growth skyrocketed at the beginning of the twenty-first century, from 6.2 million annually in 2005 to 8.4 million between 2007 and 2008.Â The airport underwent its first major expansion in 2010 in preparation for the World Cup. This expansion consisted of developing a central terminal building linking the domestic and international terminals and greatly expanding its passenger handling capabilities. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with hand-made ground textures, a true-to-life airport landside, custom night lighting, 180+ handcrafted models, custom high-definition jetways, and more. Itâs available on the iniBuilds Store for roughly $20.23, requiring at least 6.59 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 Set to Arrive on PlayStation 5 on December 3rd
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. For the first time in over 30 years, Microsoft Flight Simulator is being released on a non-Microsoft platform. Microsoft and Sony have announced that Microsoft Flight Simulator will be available on PlayStation 5 starting December 8th of this year. Players who pre-order either the deluxe or premium deluxe editions will receive early access on December 3rd. Support for PS VR2 will also be added in 2026 through a free update. Additionally, Sony has confirmed that the DualSense controller, along with its adaptive triggers, will respond to different speeds and surface types on the ground while providing varying resistance in the air. ATC communication will also be transmitted through the controller's speaker. Preorders have already begun, and those who preorder will receive the Northrop T-38A Talon. For everyone else, the Boom Supersonic XB-1 demonstrator will also be released concurrently. For the full press release, check out PlayStationâs blog. â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon! â

entry.title: Microsoft Releases World Update 20: Japan for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Microsoft has released its latest world update for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. This is the twentieth world update, and like the very first one, the team has returned to Japan to enhance the country further. This update includes updated areas and cities, new points of interest, handcrafted airports, and more. Microsoft has updated several cities, including Hiroshima, Kyoto, Osaka, Sapporo, and Tokyo. entry.title: FlightSim Studio Provides Q3 Update, Updates 727
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. FlightSim Studio has provided a roundup of its current projects following the summer break, released 727 Super27 expansion, as well as given some updates, on the newly confirmed 727-100, the E-Jets closed beta, and native MSFS 2024 Tecnam updates. The 727 Super27 expansion has now released, and FSS also provided two posts that detailed visual refreshes and system work. The headline change is an EFIS fit, paired with a new autopilot, that adds VNAV modes and RNAV approaches.Â The 727 has now also been updated to v1.1.3. Documentation is already available, and creators should have access to preview content. As a reminder, Super27 is an expansion that requires a base 727 installation (passenger or freighter).Â The EFIS and new autopilot operate with the GNS-XLS and remain optional, while the digital VSI with TCAS can be used in the base 727 when Super27 is installed. Alongside that, the studio has formally begun work on the 727-100. The plan covers a dedicated freighter and a dedicated passenger variant; convertible models are not currently planned. A Super27 treatment for the -100 is under consideration for later, but the immediate priority is to bring the variant fully into the sim first. On the E-Jets side, closed beta testing continues, with a focus on LNAV/VNAV, performance prediction, and autopilot behaviour. Issues highlighted by testers include waypoint skipping on the lateral path, intermittent drops on the vertical profile, autothrottle oscillation during step climbs, take-off Flight Director sequencing, and unreliable fuel and time estimates.Â Two departure-routing bugs have been resolved internally, though other items remain. The team is also integrating Navigraph data into the new MCDU to replace problematic stock data. This work has slowed some bug-fixing, but is expected to reduce nav-data-related reports once complete. VNAV logic already follows generated vertical profiles, handles step climbs and pre-TOD descents, and can fly RNAV approaches; however, VNAV is not enabled in the current closed beta, as stability and path generation are being improved first. Finally, the Tecnam P2006T and P2012 are being prepared as native Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 releases. The P2006T is set to receive an enhanced 3D model, new textures, improved flight dynamics, a new FS24 EFB, and a native walkaround.Â The P2012 is due for improved sounds, an FS24 EFB, and a native walkaround. Flight Sim Studios has not provided release windows for these aircraft, noting that timelines depend on parallel work elsewhere. For the full details, you can read the official update on FSS' website. For all the latest news and updates, stay tuned on Threshold! entry.title: Microsoft Releases Local Legend 22: The NAMC YS-11 for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Microsoft has, in conjunction with World Update 20, released Local Legend 22, bringing Japanâs post-war NAMC YS-11 airliner to both MSFS 2020 and MSFS 2024.Â Developed by the Nihon Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation in the late 1950s, the YS-11 first flew in 1962 and entered service three years later. A straightforward, robust design, low wing, pressurised cabin, and tricycle gear helped it find work with civil and military operators worldwide.Â Power comes from a pair of Rolls-Royce Dart Mk. 542-12K turboprops, driving four-blade, constant-speed propellers, giving the YS-11 plenty of short-field capability. In the simulator, the YS-11 is offered in two variants, Passenger and VIP Charter, and comes with a set of period-appropriate liveries. Performance figures presented with the release include a service ceiling of 23,000 feet, a maximum range of 1,485 miles, and a typical cruise speed of nearly 294 mph.Â The YS-11 also boasts impressive take-off and landing distances of 3,642 feet and 2,165 feet, respectively. For the full read, you can find Microsoft's blog post here. Local Legend 22 is now available via the in-sim marketplace for $19.99, with rental options including a seven-day pass for $9.99, a three-day pass for $6.99, and a one-day free trial. entry.title: Aeroplane Heaven Teases de Havilland Mosquito for Microsoft Flight Simulator
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Aeroplane Heaven has recently taken to Facebook to tease yet another project, providing a set of work-in-progress screenshots that reveal the legendary de Havilland DH.98 Mosquito. This reveal lands days after the developer officially announced its B-25J Mitchell, meaning Aeroplane Heaven now has two iconic World War II bombers for MSFS in the pipeline.Â Nicknamed the âWooden Wonderâ (or simply the âMossieâ), the Mosquito was one of the most versatile combat aircraft of the Second World War. It had a plywood construction, twin Rolls-Royce Merlin engines, and was a fast, agile, and adaptable aircraft, serving as a bomber, night fighter, pathfinder, and reconnaissance platform. It even carried out some of the warâs most daring precision strikes, like the famous Amiens Prison raid. The early screenshots showcase a nicely detailed cockpit, complete with scuffed paint, weathered fittings, and authentic wartime instrumentation.Â Itâs a world of chunky levers, green-painted panels, and exposed wiring, showing off what Aeroplane Heaven is well known for. Externals also make an appearance, giving us a peek at the landing gear and fuselage lines, that defined the Mosquitoâs unmistakable profile. Aeroplane Heaven has kept specifics close to its chest. We donât yet know which Mosquito variants will be modelled, or what the release timeline will be. From the look of things, the 3D modelling phase is well underway, but the larger details are still under wraps. Weâll keep you updated on the Aeroplane Heaven Mosquito!
